name: read
description: Read is used to read from file descriptors. This is an auxiliary syscall

name: write
description: Write is used to write to file descriptors. This is an auxiliary syscall

name: open
description: Open is used to open file descriptors. On Linux this opens the capability to open all kinds of descriptors including process descriptors(/proc), devices(/dev) and system object space (/sys)

name: close
description: Close is used to close an open file descriptor or socket.

name: stat
description: stat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: fstat
description: fstat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: lstat
description: lstat is used to read information about a file descriptor such as size, type and metadata.

name: poll
description: poll is used to determine whether a file descriptor is readable or writable.

name: lseek
description: lseek is used to seek the position of a file descriptor to an offset.

name: mmap
description: mmap is to map memory to the process's virtual address space. Some processes use this to efficiently read files.

name: mprotect
description: mprotect is used to change the protections on a memory page of a process. This is usually used for debug purposes.

name: munmap
description: munmap is used to unmap memory from the process's virtual address space.

name: brk
description: brk is used to set the program break for the calling process. The program break is the maximum size of memory the process can allocate.

name: rt_sigaction
description: rt_sigaction is used to set the signal handlers for the calling process.

name: rt_sigprocmask
description: rt_sigprocmask is used to change the signal mask for the calling process. The signal mask controls the behaviour when a signal is sent to the process.

name: rt_sigreturn
description: rt_sigreturn is called by the signal handler after a signal is dispatched and execution shall continue.

name: ioctl
description: ioctl is used to access special files like devices. Using ioctl you can call a device driver or a specific feature of the Linux kernel like seccomp

name: pread64
description: pread64 is a special version of read that reads at an offset to a buffer.

name: pwrite64
description: pwrite64 is a special version of write theat writes to an offset from a buffer.

name: readv
description: readv is used to read from a file descriptor using IoVecs. These structures are used to designate large areas of memory.

name: writev
description: writev is used to write to a file descriptor using IoVecs. These structures are used to designate large areas of memory.

name: access
description: access is used to test whether the calling process has access to the file. This can also be used with devices and kernel objects.

name: pipe
description: pipe is used to create a unidirectional channel for communication between processes.

name: select
description: select is used to monitor multiple file descriptors whether they are to read or write to.

name: sched_yield
description: sched_yield is used to give up the CPU for the calling thread. The next thread in queue gets executed.

name: mremap
description: mremap is used to expand, shrink or move an existing virtual memory mapping of the calling process.

name: msync
description: msync is used to sync the changes to a file that was mapped into memory with mmap back to the filesystem.

name: mincore
description: mincore is used to determine whether virtual memory is in physical RAM or on a page on disk.

name: madvise
description: madvise is used to optimize memory access by telling the kernel what it is used for to choose caching techniques.

name: shmget
description: shmget is used to get a SystemV shared memory segment or create a new one.

name: shmop
description: shmop is used to do operations on the shared memory segment. With this, a shared memory segment can be attached and detached to the process's virtual memory.

name: shmctl
description: shmctl is used to perform control operations on a shared memory segment. With this its size, permissions and more can be controlled.

name: dup
description: dup is used to create a duplicate of a file descriptor. This can be used to send file descriptors to child processes.

name: dup2
description: dup2 is used to create a duplicate of a file descriptor. This can be used to send file descriptors to child process.

name: pause
description: pause causes the calling process to sleep until a signal is delivered.

name: nanosleep
description: nanosleep is used to suspend the execution of the calling thread until the time has elapsed or a signal is delivered.

name: getitimer
description: getitimer is used to get access to a process-internal timer.

name: alarm
description: alarm sets a timer for x seconds to send a signal to the process.

name: setitimer
description: setitimer is used to arm or disarm a process-internal timer.

name: getpid
description: getpid returns the process ID of the calling process.

name: sendfile
description: sendfile copies data between one file descriptor and another.
